answers.text: Optimum Coding in the Frequency Domain

qas.question: What was the name of the codec that OCF, PFXM and other contributes merged into?
What was the first practical implementation based on?

context: The immediate predecessors of MP3 were "<a0_0>Optimum Coding in the Frequency Domain<a0_0/>" (OCF), and <a1_0>Perceptual Transform Coding<a1_0/> (PXFM). These two codecs, along with block-switching contributions from Thomson-Brandt, were merged into a codec called <a2_0>ASPEC<a2_0/>, which was submitted to MPEG, and which won the <a3_0>quality<a3_0/> competition, but that was mistakenly rejected as too complex to implement. The first practical implementation of an audio perceptual coder (OCF) in hardware (Krasner's hardware was too cumbersome and slow for practical use), was an implementation of a psychoacoustic transform coder based on <a4_0>Motorola 56000 DSP chips<a4_0/>.
